intro: Canavalia molokaiensis, commonly known as Molokaʻi morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces vibrant blue or purple flowers. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
